io.openmessaging

Interface Stream

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ServiceLifecycle

    public interface Stream
extends ServiceLifecycle
    A Queue is divided by many streams.

    A Stream object supports consume messages from a specified partition like a iterator.

    Since:
    OMS 1.0
    Version:
    OMS 1.0
    Author:
    vintagewang@apache.org, yukon@apache.org
    See Also:
    StreamingConsumer.stream(String)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MessageIterator begin()
      Fetches the first offset of this partition iterator.
      MessageIterator current()
      Fetches the current offset of this partition iterator.
      MessageIterator end()
      Fetches the last offset of this partition iterator.
      KeyValue properties()
      Returns the attributes of this Stream instance.
      MessageIterator seekByTime(long timestamp)
      Moves the current offset to the specified timestamp.

      • Methods inherited from interface io.openmessaging.ServiceLifecycle

        shutdown, startup

    • Method Detail

      • properties

        KeyValue properties()
        Returns the attributes of this Stream instance.

        There are some standard attributes defined by OMS for Stream:

        • OMSBuiltinKeys.OPERATION_TIMEOUT, the default timeout period for operations of Stream.
        • OMSBuiltinKeys.BEGIN_OFFSET, the begin offset boarder of this partition iterator.
        • OMSBuiltinKeys.END_OFFSET, the end offset boarder of this partition iterator.
        • OMSBuiltinKeys.BEGIN_TIMESTAMP, the begin offset represented by this timestamp of this partition iterator.
        • OMSBuiltinKeys.END_TIMESTAMP, the end offset represented by this timestamp of this partition iterator.
        Returns:
        the attributes

      • current

        MessageIterator current()
        Fetches the current offset of this partition iterator.
        Returns:
        the current offset, return -1 if the iterator is first created.

      • begin

        MessageIterator begin()
        Fetches the first offset of this partition iterator.
        Returns:
        the first offset, return -1 if the partition has no message.

      • end

        MessageIterator end()
        Fetches the last offset of this partition iterator.
        Returns:
        the last offset, return 0 if the iterator is first created.

      • seekByTime

        MessageIterator seekByTime(long timestamp)
        Moves the current offset to the specified timestamp.

        Moves the current offset to the first offset, if the given timestamp is earlier than the first message's store timestamp in this partition iterator.

        Moves the current offset to the last offset, if the given timestamp is later than the last message's store timestamp in this partition iterator.

        Parameters:
        timestamp - the specified timestamp
